message:
Running command: applypatch << 'PATCH'
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: reproduce_issue.py
@@
-class FakeBuffer:
-    def __init__(self, mode):
-        self.mode = mode
-        self.written = []
-    def write(self, obj):
-        # This fake buffer only accepts str, raises if bytes provided
-        if isinstance(obj, str):
-            raise TypeError("underlying buffer expects bytes, not str")
-        self.written.append(obj)
-    def __repr__(self):
-        return '<FakeBuffer mode=%r>' % (self.mode,)
+class FakeBuffer:
+    def __init__(self, mode):
+        # mode includes 'b' to simulate an underlying binary buffer
+        self.mode = mode
+        self.written = []
+
+    def write(self, obj):
+        # underlying buffer expects text (str); writing bytes should raise
+        if isinstance(obj, bytes):
+            raise TypeError("underlying buffer expects str, not bytes")
+        self.written.append(obj)
+
+    def __repr__(self):
+        return '<FakeBuffer mode=%r>' % (self.mode,)
@@
-class OldEncodedFile(object):
+class OldEncodedFile(object):
     def __init__(self, buffer, encoding):
         self.buffer = buffer
         self.encoding = encoding
     def write(self, obj):
         if isinstance(obj, six.text_type):
             obj = obj.encode(self.encoding, "replace")
         else:
             # in PY3 would raise, but simulate accepting bytes path
             pass
         self.buffer.write(obj)
@@
-class NewEncodedFile(object):
+class NewEncodedFile(object):
     def __init__(self, buffer, encoding):
         self.buffer = buffer
         self.encoding = encoding
     def write(self, obj):
         if isinstance(obj, six.text_type):
             obj = obj.encode(self.encoding, "replace")
         else:
             pass
         self.buffer.write(obj)
@@
     @property
     def mode(self):
         m = getattr(self.buffer, "mode", "")
         return m.replace('b','')
*** End Patch
PATCH

{"command":"applypatch << 'PATCH'
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: reproduce_issue.py
@@
-class FakeBuffer:
-    def __init__(self, mode):
-        self.mode = mode
-        self.written = []
-    def write(self, obj):
-        # This fake buffer only accepts str, raises if bytes provided
-        if isinstance(obj, str):
-            raise TypeError("underlying buffer expects bytes, not str")
-        self.written.append(obj)
-    def __repr__(self):
-        return '<FakeBuffer mode=%r>' % (self.mode,)
+class FakeBuffer:
+    def __init__(self, mode):
+        # mode includes 'b' to simulate an underlying binary buffer
+        self.mode = mode
+        self.written = []
+
+    def write(self, obj):
+        # underlying buffer expects text (str); writing bytes should raise
+        if isinstance(obj, bytes):
+            raise TypeError("underlying buffer expects str, not bytes")
+        self.written.append(obj)
+
+    def __repr__(self):
+        return '<FakeBuffer mode=%r>' % (self.mode,)
@@
-class OldEncodedFile(object):
+class OldEncodedFile(object):
     def __init__(self, buffer, encoding):
         self.buffer = buffer
         self.encoding = encoding
     def write(self, obj):
         if isinstance(obj, six.text_type):
             obj = obj.encode(self.encoding, "replace")
         else:
             # in PY3 would raise, but simulate accepting bytes path
             pass
         self.buffer.write(obj)
@@
-class NewEncodedFile(object):
+class NewEncodedFile(object):
     def __init__(self, buffer, encoding):
         self.buffer = buffer
         self.encoding = encoding
     def write(self, obj):
         if isinstance(obj, six.text_type):
             obj = obj.encode(self.encoding, "replace")
         else:
             pass
         self.buffer.write(obj)
@@
     @property
     def mode(self):
         m = getattr(self.buffer, "mode", "")
         return m.replace('b','')
*** End Patch
PATCH","timeout":120000,"security_risk":"LOW"}
function.name: execute_bash

args.command:
applypatch << 'PATCH'
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: reproduce_issue.py
@@
-class FakeBuffer:
-    def __init__(self, mode):
-        self.mode = mode
-        self.written = []
-    def write(self, obj):
-        # This fake buffer only accepts str, raises if bytes provided
-        if isinstance(obj, str):
-            raise TypeError("underlying buffer expects bytes, not str")
-        self.written.append(obj)
-    def __repr__(self):
-        return '<FakeBuffer mode=%r>' % (self.mode,)
+class FakeBuffer:
+    def __init__(self, mode):
+        # mode includes 'b' to simulate an underlying binary buffer
+        self.mode = mode
+        self.written = []
+
+    def write(self, obj):
+        # underlying buffer expects text (str); writing bytes should raise
+        if isinstance(obj, bytes):
+            raise TypeError("underlying buffer expects str, not bytes")
+        self.written.append(obj)
+
+    def __repr__(self):
+        return '<FakeBuffer mode=%r>' % (self.mode,)
@@
-class OldEncodedFile(object):
+class OldEncodedFile(object):
     def __init__(self, buffer, encoding):
         self.buffer = buffer
         self.encoding = encoding
     def write(self, obj):
         if isinstance(obj, six.text_type):
             obj = obj.encode(self.encoding, "replace")
         else:
             # in PY3 would raise, but simulate accepting bytes path
             pass
         self.buffer.write(obj)
@@
-class NewEncodedFile(object):
+class NewEncodedFile(object):
     def __init__(self, buffer, encoding):
         self.buffer = buffer
         self.encoding = encoding
     def write(self, obj):
         if isinstance(obj, six.text_type):
             obj = obj.encode(self.encoding, "replace")
         else:
             pass
         self.buffer.write(obj)
@@
     @property
     def mode(self):
         m = getattr(self.buffer, "mode", "")
         return m.replace('b','')
*** End Patch
PATCH
